column4: i have this funny problem with the time on my computer ... kubuntu sets the clock correct .. after servers and such .. and i think that's great ... however i recently installed windows .. and the windows clock was wront :O .. so i set it right ... but that made the linux clock go wrong .. so now i have to choose which one that should go right .. is this possible to fix?
Or tell Windows to set the local clock to GMT
Basically they both have to either set the local clock to GMT or to localtime but not one of each
No you don't have to convert anything. The timezone applies the change still, but the local clock is always GMT
